name: 大腦中的語言：心理語言學入門
goals: To introduce the students to the exciting field of language and mind.
To stimulate both creative thought and critical reading.
syllabus:
Week 1     Presentation, syllabus discussion.

Week 2     Sounds (i): how different sounds are produced

Week 3     Sounds (i): how different sounds are produced

Week 4     Sounds (ii): what is a sound? Some acoustic properties of sounds

Week 5     Sounds (iii): how are sounds perceived? Which properties are important?

Week 6     Sounds (iv): occasional speech errors and what we can learn from them

Week 7     MID-TERM EXAM (Possibly a take-home exam; to be discussed with the students)

Week 8     Words (i): mental dictionaries

Week 9     Words (ii): how do we process words so fast?

Week 10    Words (iii): morphology and word preocessing

Week 11    Sentences (i): how words are put together

Week 12    Sentences (i): how words are put together

Week 13    Sentences (ii): understanding sentences in real time: how do we do it?

Week 14    Sentences (ii): understanding sentences in real time: how do we do it?

Week 15    Sentences (ii): sentence processing

Week 16    TAKE-HOME FINAL EXAM DUE

methodologies.note: Classes will be a combination of general lectures and discussions.

grading.note: The midterm exam will cover the first section of the course (sounds). Whether it will be an in-class or a take-home exam will be discussed with the students.
The final exam will cover the second and third sections of the course (words and sentences) and it will be a take-home exam, in order to give students more time to complete the answers.
